intro: Bucco scabra, commonly known as the rough buccoid, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptations, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
